TopicTitle: Did anyone complete the career mode

Articles.Content: Did anyone complete the career mode before?

2 hours ago, T-20000 said:

Did anyone complete the career mode before?

I'd be flabbergasted if at this point nobody has completed a full career mode when multiple challenges exist for that purpose.

Yes. Multiple times. Probably in the double digits.

Two of my challenges basically require it. Neither Caveman Evolved nor The No-Contract Career require a full tech tree but it's easy to do if you complete them, seeing as you end up going most everywhere in the system by the time you're done.

I've added links to them to shamelessly plug them so you can see practical examples of people doing it.

Edited November 11, 2020 by Superfluous J
What? You don't need 100% reputation to "complete" career mode?

Considering how the science is implemented (unlocking half of the tech tree without leaving Kerbin is possible) I say it's pretty easy.

But with that said, I'm not even sure if I did it, I get bored way earlier than that, with nothing to do between key maneuvers on interplanetary voyages

15 hours ago, Popestar said:

I'd be flabbergasted if at this point nobody has completed a full career mode when multiple challenges exist for that purpose.

Prepare to be flabbergasted.

I have never "completed" career mode.  Or even gotten all that far.  It's boring.

Me: *wanting to do a Jool mission*

Contract: Dock 2 vessels around Eve

Me: Yeah no

Yes, but "only" twice so far: I abandoned my first career after visiting Duna and doing a flyby of Eve, because I had nearly all of the tech-tree unlocked and found it too easy. My second career (with only 50% science/funds/rep gain) was "completed", but I didn't visit all planets. I started my third career when Breaking Ground came out. This is also "completed" according to your definition, but I still want to finish the kolonization of the Joolian system and find all the POIs. And I just started a standard "Hard" mode career to see how well I handle no revert to launch. (I tend to rage-quit when one of my people dies.)

39 minutes ago, Geonovast said:

I have never "completed" career mode. 

So you never discovered the secrets of Nanolathing?

4 hours ago, Geonovast said:

Prepare to be flabbergasted.

I have never "completed" career mode.  Or even gotten all that far.  It's boring.

I'm not flabbergasted that it hasn't been done by anybody.  I'd be flabbergasted if nobody did it yet.
I have completed it before. Career is EASY, although, Valentina is now stuck on Laythe, but EHHH. MAYBE I will rescue her.

There is no such thing as a ‘completed’ career- just because you’ve upgraded every building and unlocked every tech tree node doesn’t mean there’s nothing left to do- land on every planet/moon and come back, build bases and stations, add more planets, use a new tech tree, add new solar systems and colonise them, etc. etc.

Completing the KSC upgrades and tech tree isn’t the end of a career, but the beginning...
I have unlocked the whole tech tree, but i havent upgraded my buildings fully yet.
